meanings.definition: To restore (land) to its natural state.
meanings.sent1: The conservationists worked hard to renature the forest after the fire.
meanings.sent2: The community project aims to renature the park by planting native trees.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a sight to see the city renature the abandoned lot into a lush green space.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts to renature the polluted river were like breathing new life into the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The process to renature the wetlands was slow but rewarding, bringing back the diverse wildlife.

meanings.definition: To return (something) to its original nature or condition.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to renature the painting to its vibrant colors by careful restoration.
meanings.sent2: The goal of the project is to renature the historic building to its former glory.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch the magician renature the torn paper back into a whole sheet.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to renature his broken spirit, filling him with hope.
meanings.sent5: The old photographs were digitally renatured to preserve them for future generations.
